page.title: 09Industry in Linlithgow
page.content: There are a lot of small businesses in the area but they don't employ a lot of people. The three main industries round Linlithgow are:G.R Stein,Racal in Linlithgow itself and BP at Grangemouth. The largest employer,G.R Stein, currently employs 537 people in the whole industry at Whitecross.103 of these people come from Linlithgow. The other smaller industries are: RY Henderson,The Abbatoir,West Port Timber,Catherwoods,Meichan and Cox,Aitken,John Campbells buses,Regent Motors,Farquarson and GR boards. During the past few years some local firms have closed down or moved out of the area.The most recent closure was the Inveresk Paper Mill at Linlithgow Bridge.
